title: Pell equations 1: A nontrivial solution always exists

blocks.name: pellexlem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ pellex . Arithmetical core of pellexlem3, norm lower bound. This begins Dirichlet's proof of the Pell equation solution existence; the proof here follows theorem 62 of [vandenDries] p. 43. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 14-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm pellexlem1(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wn(wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq))), wne(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), nat0))
} = {
  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wn(wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq)), wne(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), nat0))
  necon3bd(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), nat0, w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq))
  sylbid(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), nat0), wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq), wceq(co(c1, cexp, nat2), co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2))))
  subeq0ad(co(c1, cexp, nat2), co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  mulcld(c0, co(c2, cexp, nat2), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  sylbird(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wceq(co(c1, cexp, nat2), co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), c0))
  divmul3d(co(c1, cexp, nat2), co(c2, cexp, nat2), c0, w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  sqcld(c1, w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c0, cc))
  nncn(c0)
  sqcld(c2, w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wne(co(c2, cexp, nat2), nat0), wne(c2, nat0))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wb(wne(co(c2, cexp, nat2), nat0), wne(c2, nat0)), wcel(c2, cc))
  sqne0(c2)
  syl5ibcom(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), c0), wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq), wcel(cfv(csqrt, co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), cq))
  eqeltrd(cfv(csqrt, co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), cq, co(c1, cdiv, c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  eqtr3d(cfv(csqrt, co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), co(c1, cdiv, c2), cfv(csqrt, co(co(c1, cdiv, c2), cexp, nat2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wceq(cfv(csqrt, co(co(c1, cdiv, c2), cexp, nat2)), cfv(csqrt, co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2)))), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wne(c2, nat0))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c1, cc))
  nncn(c1)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c2, cc))
  nncn(c2)
  fveq2d(csqrt, co(co(c1, cdiv, c2), cexp, nat2), co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), w3a(wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc), wne(c2, nat0)))
  sqdiv(c1, c2)
  sqrtsqd(co(c1, cdiv, c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  redivcld(c1, c2, w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)))
  syl22anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wbr(nat0, cle, co(c1, cdiv, c2)), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1), wcel(c2, cr), wbr(nat0, clt, c2))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c1, cr))
  nnre(c1)
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(nat0, cle, c1))
  nn0ge0d(c1, wcel(c1, cn))
  nnnn0(c1)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c2, cr))
  nnre(c2)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(nat0, clt, c2))
  nngt0(c2)
  divge0(c1, c2)
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn)), wcel(co(c1, cdiv, c2), cq), wcel(c1, cq), wcel(c2, cq), wne(c2, nat0))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c1, cq))
  nnq(c1)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wcel(c2, cq))
  nnq(c2)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, cn), wne(c2, nat0))
  nnne0(c2)
  qdivcl(c1, c2)
  eleq1d(cfv(csqrt, co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), cq, cfv(csqrt, c0), wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), c0))
  fveq2(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cdiv, co(c2, cexp, nat2)), c0, csqrt)
}

blocks.name: pellexlem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ pellex . To each good rational approximation of ` ( sqrt `` D ) ` , there exists a near-solution. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 14-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: pellexlem6
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ pellex . Doing a field division between near solutions get us to norm 1, and the modularity constraint ensures we still have an integer. Returning NN guarantees that we are not returning the trivial solution (1,0). We are not explicitly defining the Pell-field, Pell-ring, and Pell-norm explicitly because after this construction is done we will never use them. This is mostly basic algebraic number theory and could be simplified if a generic framework for that were in place. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 19-Oct-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm pellexlem6(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))), nat1))))

  -| wi(w0, wn(wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wn(wa(wceq(c1, c4), wceq(c2, c5))))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c3, nat0))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(co(c1, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cexp, nat2))), c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(co(c4, cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c5, cexp, nat2))), c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c1, cmo, cfv(cabs, c3)), co(c4, cmo, cfv(cabs, c3))))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c2, cmo, cfv(cabs, c3)), co(c5, cmo, cfv(cabs, c3))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)

  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))), nat1)))), wi(w0, wn(wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cq))))

  a1ii(wi(w0, wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))), nat1)))), diffsw(s1, w0))
  syl3anc(w0, wrex(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cn, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(cv(s1), cexp, nat2))), nat1))), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cdiv, c3)), cn), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(co(co(c2, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c1, cmul, c5)), cdiv, c3)), cn), wceq(co(co(cfv(cabs, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cdiv, c3)), cexp, nat2), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(cfv(cabs, co(co(co(c2, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c1, cmul, c5)), cdiv, c3)), cexp, nat2))), nat1))
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cfv(cabs, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cdiv, c3)), cn), wcel(co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cdiv, c3), cz), wne(co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cdiv, c3), nat0))
  mpbird(w0, wcel(co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cdiv, c3), cz), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cdiv, c3)), cz))

  mpbid(w0, wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5)))), cmo, cfv(cabs, c3)), nat0), wceq(co(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmin, co(c0, cmul, co(c2, cmul, c5))), cmo, cfv(cabs, c3)), nat0))

  syl221anc(w0, wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c4), cmo, cfv(cabs, c3)), co(co(c4, cmul, c4), cmo, cfv(cabs, c3))), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c4, cr), wcel(c4, cz), wcel(cfv(cabs, c3), crp), wceq(co(c1, cmo, cfv(cabs, c3)), co(c4, cmo, cfv(cabs, c3))))

blocks.name: pellex
blocks.content: Every Pell equation has a nontrivial solution. Theorem 62 in [vandenDries] p. 43. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 19-Oct-2014.)
blocks.origin:
